intro: Oenothera brachysepala, commonly known as the short-stalked evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Oenothera brachysepala produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
